titles: Smectymnuus redivivus Being an answer to a book, entituled, An humble remonstrance. In which, the original of liturgy episcopacy is discussed, and qu√¶ries propounded concerning both. The parity of bishops and presbyters in scripture demonstrated. The occasion of the imparity in antiquity discovered. The disparity of the ancient and our moderne bishops manifested. The antiquity of ruling elders in the church vindicated. The prelaticall church bounded.
author: Smectymnuus.
Marshall, Stephen, 1594?-1655.
Calamy, Edmund, 1600-1666.
Young, Thomas, 1587-1655.
Newcomen, Matthew, 1610?-1669.
Spurstowe, William, 1605?-1666.
publisher: Printed by T. C. for John Rothwell, a the Fountaine and Beare in Goldsmiths-row in Cheapside,
notes: Errors in paging: pages misnumbered and bound out of order.
Wing attributes authorship to Stephen Marshall, who, with Edmund Calamy, Thomas Young, Matthew Newcomen and William Spurstowe, written under the acronym, Smectymnuus.
keywords: Hall, Joseph, 1574-1656. --  Humble remonstrance to the high court of Parliament.
